title: Registration Specialist Interview

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: phone interview after online application process and calling to request an interview this was looking up the hiring manager and follow up through calls and emails there was a few weeks waiting for a call back

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN)

title: Talent Acquisition Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN)
Interview Descriptions: There are Two interviews with different people and it was not very in depth. Just neutral. I would come with a lot of questions because it doesn’t go in depth.

title: Sr Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview was first conducted by panel of my current manager and peers focusing both on technical soft skills. Next there were two more rounds of panel interviews with Leadership team which focused on my soft skills.
Interview Questions: what will you miss from your current job. situation question such as how you managed competing priorities

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: I completed the application, HR called for phone interview, then hiring manager called for brief phone interview, then zoom interview with hiring supervisor and 2 others. Called within the week to offer the job
Interview Questions: What relevant experience to you bring to this role?

title: Digital Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: A surprise panel of 10+ people was used for my first interview. The interviewers were late and I felt they were dismissive of my questions and responses to their questions. Very strange interview process and I was never contacted to let me know if I got the job/if they passed
Interview Questions: Since you aren’t a minority, how do you plan to incorporate diversity into your role?

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: It was very simple and easy. Basically hires you on the spot. Very quick process. They do not ask a lot of questions. You also go on a transport with someone to get a feel for the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Everyone was very nice. The interview started on time and was direct and to the point. The initial interview was remote. Overall, it was an easy process and pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview started off with taking about myself and what relevant experience I have. I was asked specific questions about why I would like to work there and my expectations of the job.
Interview Questions: Q: Share a time you have to deal with an ethical dilemma?

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: Very open, transparent, and professional . Did not feel pressured or stressful. Told me alot about the position and answered all my questions. Explained peer interview process and expectations. Friendly and impressive Iinterviewers.
Interview Questions: Whatbis your 5 year plan?

title: Registration Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Portland, IN) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: The staff that did the interview was very supportive and friendly.  They are looking for team members that share the same values and goals as they have.  IU health is a great company to work for.
Interview Questions: Describe how to deal with a stressful situation.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University Health in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening - about 5-10 minute call to see if it's fit 1st interview - with the hiring manager about 30 min 2nd interview - with the manager 3rd interview - interview with the peers
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position? Tell me more about yourself

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview was with 2 unit managers. They asked about previous work history and experience, etc, as well as questions regarding difficult experiences and how they were handled. It was a pretty straightforward process.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you experienced adversity in the workplace and how you overcame it.

title: Clinical Services Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews & once hired the waiting period for orientation is a lengthy. They only complete a once monthly organization orientation due to the size of the company. Orientation is wonderful however.
Interview Questions: What was my ideal work environment?

title: SPA Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: Several interviews, direct mgr, then peers, then with staff for a half day shadow,  then with directors. Seemed as though they were looking to intimidate me, little real vibes of teamwork or cohesiveness.
Interview Questions: What do you think you’ll need most from me as your leader?

title: Clinical Nurse, Ambulatory Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: personable, laid back, wanted to get to know you as a person, first.  Then inquired about clinical background and experience. Afterwards, gave tour of facility and was introduced to office staff.
Interview Questions: How do you manage conflict

title: Practice Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: 3 levels of interviews; HR - manager - team.  The team was difficult as they were new managers with little experience interviewing.  They did it via teams and felt very distracted.  HR and manager were very personable though.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with challenging providers?

title: IS Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview will usually be with your manager/director and some people on your team. Pretty laid back easy interview. Usually 2 rounds of interviews with the second round being with the team you would be working with and the first being with just your manager and a team lead or senior analyst.
Interview Questions: 5 Star Method of Interviewing

title: Logistics Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Indiana University Health in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was quick but a lot of questions. the pay for IU is low. very disappointing for how big the organization is. They need to just bump pay and i would of considered.
Interview Questions: what are your weaknesses at work?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions:
Standard interviewing process. 
Asked about prior work experiences
Wanted to know how I handle different situations with workers.
How did I handle myself when something did not go my way?
Discussed how my previous work experiences will work with this job I am applying for
Interview Questions: How did you deal with a person who was not performing on your team?

title: New Grad RN Emergency Department Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Lafayette, IN) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Organized, professional yet laid back enough to make me feel comfortable. Gave me background information about the company and also why they believe the company is good. Was very willing to answer my questions.
Interview Questions: "Tell me a little about yourself"

title: Staff Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was in person and in their main building. They contact me through email and schedule a time that works for both of us.  And every thing was going so smooth.
Interview Questions: What is your expectation of the position?

title: Evs Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions:
Very easy going and nice interview. Still need to be respectful and professional, but all over they made it nice and easy. 
I also got a call back soon after getting hired.
Interview Questions: They ask about your experience mostly

title: Financial Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Indiana University Health in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: It consists of phone screen, interviewing with managers, and peer interview. It went pretty smoothly, and it was great. The process is very smooth. It’s more of getting to know one another and see if this is the right fit.
Interview Questions: Why this position and why IU Health?

title: ICU Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Fishers, IN) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very open and kind recruiter that made me feel valued and welcomed. I was very nervous, but the interviewer made me feel at ease. I was impressed with her knowledge of the company and passion for the facility.
Interview Questions: What do you think makes a good nurse?

title: Sr Data Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Initial call to explore interests/soft skills.  Then more in-depth call with more technical questions.  Then team interview with whiteboard, mostly about coding style and knowledge of database queries.   Team lead took a lot of extra time to ensure I understood the role and various factors impacting the team and company.  Team was professional, welcoming, intelligent, competent.  Passed up position only because of another offer.
Interview Questions: I don't recall any specific questions.  Fairly standard intros, discussion of past projects, etc.

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: 3 step interview process. Final step is peer interview with one or two people you would work with. Slow process to get each interview scheduled. Managers were nice and conversational during all interviews
Interview Questions: What are your professional goals

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: A staffing agent reached out to me on Indeed. After applying I talked with the agent on the phone about the job, and about two weeks later received an invitation for an online interview. I interviewed on a Friday, and got the offer next Tuesday.
Interview Questions: A lot of behavioral and situational questions(Tell me a time when you have to take action and make a decision.)

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: First met with manager then toured unit then peer interview.  I spent about two hours on the unit. Shadowed a nurse for a while. It was a positive experience overall.
Interview Questions: How do you handle feedback or constructive criticism?

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: A ten minute call by assistant Human Resource person allowed minimal info to me or from me. Very little explanation of what job consisted of or desired candidate for position
Interview Questions: Availability, job history, what was I looking for

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had a virtual interview for this position. It was very informative. I left the meeting with a clear understanding of the position. I was given plenty of time to talk about my experience and the interviewer was easy to speak with.
Interview Questions: When was a time you made improvements to a program?

title: Medical Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview.  2 interview process.  Basic Interview questions.  Tell me about yourself.  Tell me about why you are interested in joining IU Health.  Very friendly and easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: What makes you want to join IU Health?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Bloomington, IN) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: fairly easy, was emailed with a coupe of days and interview the next week, questions came from a Google search anyone could easily find, and were easy to answer. There was no discussion about the position unless I asked questions, which I did in order to understand the position past the job posting
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: I have interviewed with IU Health a total of maybe 4 times, including group/2nd interviews. I have applied at least 10 times total. I was ghosted every time I interviewed and turned down via email for each time I didn't get an interview. I think I've been perfectly qualified for the positions I applied to, sometimes over-qualified, given I have a bachelor's degree. Don't apply to this company unless you can get a referral, cause they'll just blow you off and waste your time.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for IU Health?

title: Patient Safety Companion Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: It was great. the manager was very informative and honest with the job description as well as giving scenario based examples of the things I may encounter on the job.
Interview Questions: do I take criticism personally

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: There were a few rounds of interviews including some with HR and then with team and hiring manager. Can take some time to get back to you but average wait time.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Lafayette, IN) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had an online interview with the hiring manager.  She was nice and the process was smooth.  All my questions were answered completely.  The hiring manager was also very complimentary of the company.

title: Finance Intern Interview

Interview Descriptions: Very informal and personal. Wanted to get to know you as a person so they could teach you about the job. Cared about interests as well as Why Healthcare? Why IUH?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions:
Very nice process, they were more interested in the kind of candidate and how well of a team player he is.
Got the offer for the role of business analyst. Very good management team.

title: Safety Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Two separate virtual interviews that were essentially the exact same interview just with two different groups of people. Interviewers were friendly and courteous. Could have stream lined the process and time spent by doing one interview.

title: Medication History Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: Pleasant, no issues, on time, straightforward, kind, patient. Open and clean environment . Easy and quick process, very thorough in explaining job roles. I recommend for beginners with no experience.

title: Nursing Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is good, they asked various questions that were easy to answer and think about.  Every interviewer/manager has been good about making it feel like a conversation. Overall, good process.

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: I only had one interview. I was hired on the spot. Managment was very welcoming. Interview was 30 minutes. Asked about work experiences. They really wanna know more about you as a person. They also wanna know how you work under pressure.
Interview Questions:
Q: Tell me about your self ?

Q: What was your last job like ? 

Q: Do you have any experience in medical field

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of several conversations - 1:1 with the director and each of the managers, and then a conversation with the staff analysts.  It was very helpful to interact with the team and ask candid questions to get a sense of the culture and day-to-day experience at work.  The quality of the interview helped me make a confident decision to accept the role.
Interview Questions: What are techniques or strategies that you use to deal with stressful situations at work?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was fairly easy. Questions pertained about handling situations and self improvement. Offer was made the next day. Hiring process itself was fairly quick. Nurse managers are very involved in the hiring process
Interview Questions: What are some of your weaknesses?

title: Clinical Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Multiple layers of interview process.  The hiring manager usually reaches out for phone interview. Followed by multiple other interviews with peers.  I've done as many as five interviews before getting the rejection letter automated.  It's defeating.
Interview Questions: Basic questions, tell me about yourself and why you want to work here are the go to questions.  Then there are situational questions.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview then in person. If you passed the phone interview you will then go to a team interview.  My first interview was with the HR team. HR was a basic first interview.
Interview Questions: Job related to what you were applying for.  What are your strengths for the role.

title: Physician, Nephrology Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: Virtual interviews with numerous faculty. This was done to avoid unnecessary travel and exposure to viral infection. Good screening method for both parties. Easy process without difficulty, and clear communication.
Interview Questions: Desire to work in Indiana

title: Payroll Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy, it was a pretty simple interview. Basic questions about how I handled teamwork, challenges and obstacles, and what I did to stand out. Definitely an average interview.
Interview Questions: Provide an example of a time where you overcame a challenge.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: First we sat down for typical  interview questions and then we went on a tour around the unit to meet the other staff members and get a feel for the unit.
Interview Questions: What qualities would you bring to the unit?

title: Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: It was seamless. They first called me to set up a time to interview. Then proceeded to have me meet them in person in which they asked relevant questions about my career.
Interview Questions: They asked about my clinical experience

title: Dietetic Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and laid back process. Took awhile to finally get a call back after applying but is worth the wait. Great people and you must work every other holiday
Interview Questions: Pretty typical questions asked in an interview

title: Anesthetist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Indiana University Health in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter interview to start. Very friendly with basic questions about your motivations for applying, importance of patient care etc.  then they tell you about the benefits package, ask you about your living arrangement plans etc
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: RN Nurse Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: 3 step process. Well designed. Internet application. Talent team sets up interview. Choice of 3 positions to interview. Met with each manager. Had peer interview. I was not a fan of the peer interview as they were not trained and seemed like a popularity contest.
Interview Questions: What is one strength that you offer.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: All virtual, no direct verbal contact. You are prompted with questions and your record your answer. It was confusing and unreliable due to my poor internet connection. I would have rather done a phone interview.
Interview Questions: I did not get through the set of questions due to dropped internet connection

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Bloomington, IN) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was very helpful and assisting me with any questions I had. They gave me a tour of the facilities and explained the day to day work processes.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would fit into this working environment?

title: Human Resources/Non-clinical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was lengthy and time-consuming. Had to be interviewed by a number of managers, and due to difficulty of coordinating their schedules, it equated to a drawn-out, four interview process. Although I was a finalist for the job, there was no further communication to let me know I would not be hired. Basically, they ghosted me.
Interview Questions:
What was a challenging situation you faced, and how did you handle it?
How do you deal with working with people you don't get along with?

title: RCS Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was very polite and engaged. I felt that she was really interested in getting to know me. She was focused on finding the right fit for her team and not just some random person. Even if I’m not offered the position, the interview was a real confidence booster.
Interview Questions: How does my past experience prepare me for this position

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: Easy and quick, contacted me within a few days and set up the interview quickly.  They were friendly, enjoyed the interview.  Job shadow was after the interview so I could see if I would be a good fit.
Interview Questions: What their values were and how I applied them to my job

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone interview with recruiter.  Asked questions like why I wanted to work at IU. Then had face to face with manager, followed by a peer interview.  Shadowed a RN for a couple of hours.
Interview Questions: Why wanted to work at Iu health

title: Supply Chain Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions:
After around 4 weeks without hearing from anyone I received an email asking to set up a phone interview. The phone interview lasted an hour and I believe it went very well. She advised me to email her or call her with any additional questions that I might have. I thanked her and ended up emailing her around an hour later as a couple of questions came to mind and I wanted to thank her for her time again. I received no response. I waited around a week and sent a follow up email advising my strong interest in the position and let her know that I would be happy to provide any references needed to support my resume. No response. Apparently IU health does not provide emails to applicants stating they were not chosen for a position. It wasn't until another two weeks later that I logged on to see if there were any other jobs available (as I have been wanting to work with IU Health for many years) and noticed that my application stated I was not chosen. 
It was completely unprofessional for my interviewer to not respond to either email, and poor practice for the IU Health to not send emails advising applicants of the decision. This was a very unfortunate experience.
Interview Questions: I was asked a lot of value based questions and how I would handle difficult situations between supply chain and nursing managers.

title: Software Test Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward. Simple questions. Did have some information mixups (contradicting information) but it got ironed out.  Very friendly but not very up to date on current tech or agile practices but they were working towards it
Interview Questions: How would you test this site

title: ER Medical Scribe Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Bloomington, IN) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Great process! I loved the people and the questions. It was very fair and the people were easy to get to know.  The questions were relevant to my experience and I was able to engage very easily with the interview
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Bloomington, IN) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
-describe position 
-responsibilities 
-explained work life and schedule 
-explained where work happened 
-explained benefits and expectations 
-explained uniforms 
-explained training process
-asked multiple scenario type questions
—asked personality questions
-asked about capabilities and comfort ability
Interview Questions: Name a time you had to work with a team and help manage

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Ok not a lot of stress laid back, was friendly and nice people asked great questions and share information about the company and the changes that where happing. I was glad to learn about how things  come alone
Interview Questions: What is the best thing about the job ?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and completed one phone screen and two rounds of interviews. After the final round, they didn’t contact me to share results and ignored my follow up inquiries. For all the talk during interviews about how great of a workplace this is, the lack of professional courtesy in the way they treat people is deeply disappointing.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience with financial analysis in previous roles

title: Compliance Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had to apply and get the interview set up. I then got the interview set up and I met them on campus at Methodist hospital campus, downtown Indianapolis. First there was a Group interview with the team member that are currently on the compliance team. They asked me multiple behavioral questions. Next, I had a  1:1 with the supervisor of the team. Here she asked me questions about myself and explained the position and asked more behavioral questions and my goals and aspirations.
Interview Questions: Would you say that you are organized?

title: Sr Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with all supervisors I would be working with. About six total, all in one day which I appreciated. Took about 3 hours total. The interview questions put you in a scenario, theyre not super basic. For example, tell me about a time you did xyz. The questions will make you think and you shouldn't give general answers, be specific.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you had to have a difficult conversation with an employee and how it was resolved

title: Marketing Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy and somewhat drawn out. All in all it included 1 screening phone call, 1 phone interview, and a 2-hour in person interview with 5 different employees at varying levels of seniority. Everyone I interacted with was kind, positive, welcoming, and professional.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you made a mistake and what you did to resolve it.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: The manager was really nice and caring. The interview process as a whole was easy and nonthreatening. As long as you are a good, hard-working person, the interview should not be a problem.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work on this floor?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: it was a long process took about 3 weeks. consisted of interview with recuriter then in person interview, followed by fit test, drug screen and background check. pretty simple but long
Interview Questions: simple just asked about experience and background.

title: PRN Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of 1.5 hours of interview time, 1 hour peer interview/lunch, 3.5 hours of clinical observation, so 9am to 3pm. The initial interview was with the manager and supervisor and consisted of about 45 minutes of answering questions and about 45 minutes of them discussing their facility and operations.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was ok and simple. The questions were based on trying to get to know you better and to see if your a better fit for the position. Not as hard as I thought l.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position

title: Entry-Level Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was conducted by 7 people: Upper management and peer interview. They acted like it was not worth it to be there, so I was not surprised when I did not get a reply after the interview.
Interview Questions: Behavioral, They probably got it from the internet. The Director of the unite was reading it from the internet.  He did not even bother to hide it. I interviewed with 4 different departments at IUHEALTH and non of them ever got back to me, even to tell me that I was not selected.

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with  clinical nurse manager, patient coordinator  and administrative director.  Interview style was questions about professional history, work style, And  how I could contribute to the position.  Definitely felt like they were trying to determine if I would be a good fit  for their needs.  Felt formal with specific questions. But also allowed for conversation style  interviewing.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time that was challenging for you and how you handled it ( professional example ).  They asked for stories or Case examples from my professional experience

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions:
There were several interviews: Phone interview, Interview with potential Director, Half day interview with team, Interview with VP of division.

Each interviewer prided themselves on the number of hours they worked - I did get the impression that they were attempting to weed people out (or perhaps scare them off?) by repeatedly mentioning the long hours.
Interview Questions: Q: Are you prepared to work more than 40 hours a week?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN)
Interview Descriptions: It was very disorganized with mixed messages and no follow-ups. It took me nearly 3 months to be hired. I was very frustrated by the process and felt lost/confused throughout the process. They would follow-up to say they’ll have a decision soon and then not contact me for another few weeks.
Interview Questions: What functions to you know in excel?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied through my college's career portal and received an email inviting me to interview. I was out of the state of Indiana so I interviewed via skype. I was interviewed by three people, who would each be managing teams of interns.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with Data visualization software like Tableau or Power BI?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Carmel, IN) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very Easy and simple interview process. Straightforward and typical - phone interview first and then usually about a 30 minute in person interview. Usually a job offer shortly after the interview unless they have many candidates
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when…. Type of questions

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Bloomington, IN) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had one interview with the RN/Office Manager and it was fantastic. She truly had my best interest in mind, even though it didn't work out. The office manager gave me insight into future career choices and also hospital contacts.
Interview Questions: Explain a situation where you went above and beyond for a patient to make their experience better.

title: Finance Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview with manager, team and Director. Mainly behavioral and fit questions around values. 3 3omin interviews over two weeks 2 in round 1 and 1 in round 2. Very relaxed and friendly interviewers
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, why are you interested in this role, tell us about a time when...

title: Clinical Nurse Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I have not gone through the standard hiring procedure, as I was first found via resume search and then kept in contact with HR when again attempting job placement. That being said, HR first contacted me and did a standard screening, then resume was forwarded to hiring managers. Then interview with hiring manager first via telephone, then group interview, then physician interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Information Operations Building Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I met with the chair of the department, a representative from the finance department, and interviewed with the person currently holding the manager position, going through the ins and outs of the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for IU Health?

title: CMA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Muncie, IN) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Thorough and pleasant. The lady interviewing me was so nice and made it a very comfortable experience. I was asked very typical interview questions, but the hiring manager was engaging and responsive, which made it easier to relax and focus.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in 5 years?

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process took forever because they took a long time to transfer me and provide me with my offer letter. I had to call the manager to actually get an interview because they never reached out to me. They sent an email stating they sent my application to the manager but never heard back from anyone.
Interview Questions: Can you work every other weekend ?

title: Clinical Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: There was two phone interviews and then an in person interview. Finally, I had an interview with Human Resources. Salary was non-negotiable. I was able to start a month and a half after I accepted the position.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Bloomington, IN) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was easy and quick. The nurse manager asked a series of 5 questions and wrote down my answers. After she was done she invited the charge nurse in to interview me and ask a series of her own questions.
Interview Questions: Name a time in which you overcame an obstacle or learned from an experience?

title: HRSS Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online.  Phone interview. In person interview with direct manager,. I had to draft a brochure and pretend offer letter. The second interview was in person with dept director and team members.  Got an offer hours after my interview, but they immediately rescinded as the offer was sent in error and sent prematurely, waited two weeks since erroneous offer and still no update. I found out that I didn't get the job via not getting an offer. I wasn't contacted
Interview Questions: how are you working with a team of mostly women

title: Clinical Nurse Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: interview with the program manager and with 4 other peers. they were very interested in being committed to the hospital.  many of the questions were specific to what passions and interest you could bring to their organization.
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 10 years

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview followed by two in person interviews.  Interviewed with hiring manager,  director of department,  and a few members of current team. Had to take computer assessment which was on MS Word.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions. Also, what success means to you. Asked about strengths and weaknesses.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: very professional and friendly managers, had a tour of the unit, shadow with one of the nurse,  I had an option to choose a different unit than the one I have been interviewed for. They also  waited for me to pass the boards.  I went through the residency program for the new grads. Overall a good experience.
Interview Questions: What the reason you choose our unit?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: Extensive detail regarding previous employment, make sure you mention specific skills and  how you used them in your job. Relate back to the position. I have three people from management in the room included the manager, supervisor, and a team lead.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you had to deal with a difficult customer?

title: Transformation Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Easy. It was focused on  willingness to learn. Instill lean principles and  work culture. Questions were behavioral and situational. The have high emphasis on rendering lean culture for effective outcome. They even evaluated data skills considering the role requires you to handle data and create visuals for their team.
Interview Questions: A situation when you failed

title: Patient Visitor Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN)
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to interview with 2 managers. They took the time to get to know me and my background. I was actually better suited for a different position so they let me know a few weeks later when a spot opened up and offered me the position over the phone. Very quick, very easy. No weird personality tests.
Interview Questions: What makes you a great fit for this position, over anyone else?

title: BI Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: 1 - on -1 interview with the director and my manager. It was a Semi - formal and after a week, I got an offer. I was with them for 1 year. That gave me a headstart in my BI Career.
Interview Questions: Statistical Analysis and what method are applicable

title: Payroll Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening, interview in person. Interview is in a group setting. Multiple interviewers. Ask behavioral interview questions such as "tell me about a time you had to face your greatest weakness" etc.
Interview Questions: What is your five year plan?

title: Finance Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back interview. Behavior based questions were asked . It was nore abput learning about what the team did and if I would be a good fit. I loved how the team was brought in and I was able to ask them questions as well.
Interview Questions: How were my excel skills and why I wanted to work for them.

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions:
The process started with a phone call from a recruiter with normal screening questions verifying education and experience, salary requirements etc. Next I was directed to fill out a background check and detailed reference form online. I was asked to come to the hospital for a an in person interview about a week later.

The interview was with the regional lab director and two of the technical supervisors.  They were very friendly and set me quite at ease. After talking about skills and background the asked a fairly lengthy set of behavioral questions and gave me a tour of the lab.
Interview Questions: Think a close friend. (waits for response) Imagine they have the same education and experience, should we hire them or you.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview then in person interview with managers.  It didnt take too long to have an offer.  They require 3 references during their hiring process.  The interviews included time with managers and also with peers.  Everyone seemed nice and professional
Interview Questions: Standard questions not behavioral based

title: Patient Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a great interview process. They focused on what you could bring as far as values and what their goals were. All expectations and exactly what the job entailed
Interview Questions: What are your values based off of?

title: Cashier/Barista Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Lafayette, IN) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Flexible for a time that I was available then we interviewed in the open, common area. Standard questions were asked of "what is your experience" and "how do you deal with difficult customers". They were friendly during the interview and worked to keep away the nerve. After, I was sent home and received a call-back within a week. Paperwork was filed at a different appointment.
Interview Questions:
How do you handle difficult customers?
What are some of your flaws?
How is your experience valuable to us?

title: Revenue Cycle Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview with a recruiter , then large panel interview, and then sent to shadow. If you have any knowledge of healthcare or customer service it will be an easy interview.
Interview Questions: Basic  STAR method questions

title: I Connect Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: It went shortly and smoothly. I interviewed with three people. Typical questions about customer service.  How you handle situations in the workplace. Relaxed and professional.  Arrive early if it's downtown, the traffic and parking are bad
Interview Questions: How did you handle upset customers.

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: It is very hard to get your application through the computer screening.  Afters mos of applying I was contacted by HR for a phone  interview and it was easy.  The hr rep set up interviews based on my goals and I  interviewed with a manager and received an offer on the spot.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: This was a basic one-on-one interview with my direct supervisor. It was relatively informal and comfortable. It lasted approximately one hour, and I left knowing I would be offered the position.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my previous experience, why I was looking to change careers, my education and qualifications, etc.

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is generally an hour length shadowing, followed by an interview with the manager. Quick and professional, the real hurdle is waiting for the initial call to set up an interview time. I hear that Methodist is working on a new system to make recruiting time quicker. I think I waited 2-3 weeks before I was called for an interview.
Interview Questions: Average interview, no hard questions. Just be honest about your experiences.

title: Clinical Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had initial HR screening phone call. Then call with dept manager. Then Skype meeting with one PI and face to face meeting with each of 3 other Drs. This process took about a week. I then got an offer. I negotiated which took another week.
Interview Questions: Briefly went over my resume and experience with each Dr.  They each gave a background of the position and what their studies were.

title: Staff Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: One interview at the office in downtown Indianapolis. Typical interview and interview questions. I applied online and received a call about a week later. I received the offer without knowledge. The HR director called and gave me information about orientation. I was never asked if I accepted but OF COURSE I WAS GOING TO!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Reference check before interview. Interview with unit manager, peer interview, then job shadow. Peer interview wanted to know work ethic, attendance, etc. Stated they would make a decision by next day, called with offer within 24 hours.
Interview Questions: Describe a rough work situation and how did you handle it?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: I did a two part interview. Supervisor was nice and did have typical interview questions. They explained duties, hours, pay, answered my questions, etc. The job was for a new clinic so once hired I had to wait over a month before starting.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years. What are your goals. How do you handle said situation.

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The initial "interview" was a recruiter that asks you a couple of questions and then schedules an actual interview on the unit with the managers. The actual interview on the was about 2 hours. I shadowed on the unit for 1 hour and then the actual interview was about an hour. The interview was pretty informal.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you had to deal with a difficult patient or customer and how you handled the situation.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job online and was called in for an interview about 2 weeks later.  It was very organized. I had a 2+hour interview with 9 different people in a panel style.  I was never called back to say the job was filled.   I never heard anything even after email and letter follow ups.
Interview Questions: What is your organizational style?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and got a call from the hiring manager about a month later. After a phone screen for about an hour, I was invited to an on-site interview within a couple weeks. 

I interviewed for an hour with the hiring manager and was told that a decision would be made in a couple of weeks. Two weeks after the interview, I received an e-mail stating that there would be an additional round of on-site interviews with others I could be working with. 

I interviewed with 3 different people, each explaining the roles this project manager position would fill for them. Their accounts were somewhat conflicting, with some expecting higher-level corporate functions and some expecting more of an administrative/secretarial position. I was unsure how the role fit into the overall company structure, so I completed the interview and moved on.
Interview Questions: Describe three of your weaknesses.

title: Lactation Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN)
Interview Descriptions: I started at this hospital from ground up.  I was proven and tried and was offered this position without an interview ,  I was already a special care nursery  RN and Post Partum RN.
Interview Questions: How are you with breastfeeding?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: One interview with the manager then a 4hr shadow with a nurse on the unit. The shadow was based on the shift you would be working. The person you followed for your shadow filled out a paper that said if they thought you should be hired.
Interview Questions: Q: What do you look for in a clinical unit?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I was briefly interviewed over the phone by HR and then scheduled for interview with multiple floor managers. Half the people didn't even show up for a scheduled interview and it was a brief (less than 10 minute) interview. I had to email and check on status to find out I was not hired.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: HR reached out to me and asked some general questions. A week later an in person interview was scheduled. I was interviewed by a panel of directors, without notice beforehand that there would be 10 directors present and asking questions. Told me they would get back to me within two weeks. Two weeks came and went so I inquired about the position with HR - no answer (I left voicemails, sent emails, etc). I received an email after two months stating they went with another candidate.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when a project did not go as planned. What happened and what was the outcome?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was very brief.  The environment was easy going! The provider was easy to talk to!  They made it seem like we were just having a conversation and not an actual interview!  They asked in regards to describing myself,  what I can bring to the facility, weakness,  strengths,  a few behavioral/ situational type questions!
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: Compliance Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN)
Interview Descriptions: It felt like a mechanical process - it seemed like the people conducting the interview already had a preferred internal candidate in mind and they were just fulfilling a legal obligation to interview external candidates so that they could close the job posting. It was a waste of time and energy.
Interview Questions: How do you resolve conflict?

title: Care Giver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN)
Interview Descriptions: Nice, very interested in me.  Asked me what I expected, told me what they expected, took me on a tour, all over the hospital.  met some of the executives and other administrators who stopped to talk with me and asked questions.  told me about the culture and history of the hospital.  very nice people.
Interview Questions: what were my professional goals, were working weekends ok, did I work well in a team

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of an online application and followed by a phone call of interest ( I called them to let them know I was very interested) 1 st innterview with department manager and two weeks later a second interview and offer was given to me
Interview Questions: It was a very long time ago but I do remember them asking about time management

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I went up to the unit and shadowed another young woman in my prospective position for about 1.5 hours or so and then I was interviewed by the manager. The woman that interviewed me was very pleasant, so much so it didn't even feel like an interview, but rather more of a conversation.
Interview Questions: Basic demographic questions, where do I see myself going with the career field, describe an encounter with a patient in which things didn't go as well as I had planned

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: I took classes to get a job through a outside training company that was contract with (Clarian) at the time. After completion of the class I was offered an interview that was quick and professional, then I had to take a personality test and afterwards they told me I passed.
Interview Questions: Where did I see myself 5 years from now

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN)
Interview Descriptions: The process took 5 weeks. I got a call asking to come in for a face to face interview 2 weeks after I applied. The interview lasted about 20 mins. They focused a lot on behavioral interview questions. I got a call 3 weeks after I interviewed and they offered me the position.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with interpersonal conflict?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Face to face interview with supervisor, Department Head and nurses from other specialty offices. There were rapid fire questions from each. Not all of the interviewers were welcoming. All in all it was a positive experience.
Interview Questions: How will you make each day different?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
First you fill out a survey which requires you to get a certain score to get forwarded to HR.

Then you have to get 5 letters of recommendation, then interview which is overkill.

Then you have to have a in-person interview with your manager.

Overall the interview process was easy going and didn't require much preperation.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at IU health?

title: Safety and Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Bloomington, IN) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed, I believed they asked the usual questions. What do I like about current job? Rate your supervisors. Why do you want to work here. They told me that another employee that knew me had asked why I had never been hired or interviewed because they knew that I could perform the job and they needed help and were very short staffed.
Interview Questions: They asked what I thought about my current supervisors.

title: Scheduling Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: Filled out application online. Called for face to face interview. Very laid back, easy going. Interviewer was very friendly and personable. Basic interview questions were asked. Got a tour of the office when completed.
Interview Questions: Describe your ability to deal with difficult people.

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Bedford, IN) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the HR office in Indianapolis with an invitation for an interview, which I had with the floor manager and two RNs in an office. They had papers on which to write with suggested questions and they recorded my responses and scored me.
Interview Questions: They asked me to give an example of a time I made a mistake.

title: Lpn Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Carmel, IN) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initially did a phone interview.  Had in person interview at a neutral location.  Then had a second interview in person with the provider.  Standard interview questions were asked. Was asked salary expectations.
Interview Questions: What are your salary expectations?

title: EOHS Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview. Was not stressful. Met with the program facsilator and their manager. The question were about interpersonal communication skills, both verbal and written. We also got into some problem solving stuff.
Interview Questions: Can you work independently.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Terrible HR experience, bungled the the time of the interview, required completion of two irrelevant assessments and then no communication of their decision until I checked their job website. They provided no next steps after my interview with the hiring manager until they posted the rejection. Overall not at all impressed.
Interview Questions: What is your ideal day

title: Med Tech II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Brief phone screen with HR.  Quickly offered to interview with shift technical coordinator.  Extremely easy peer interview. It was the most stress free interview I have been on.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a conflict with a co-worker?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the division manager, the COO, and the lead physician in the practice. I was asked general interview questions as well as questions about my areas of special interest, which did include some clinical questions. I do recall being asked for specific examples of how I handed difficult clinical situations. They seemed very concerned with piecing out my "customer service" abilities and less concerned about my clinical skills, which I partially attribute to having a reference from a well-respected physician in the community (which is to say someone with out that may be asked more about their clinical skills).
Interview Questions: I was asked to describe a difficult situation with a dissatisfied patient and how I handled it.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: called in for interview , job shadow , offer hr called to sumbit references and they called me a week or two later telling me the date of orientation , orientation is 8 hrs long
Interview Questions: how much experience

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: Was brought in to speak with director. Very friendly and easy to talk to. Asked me why I was interested in the job and what I wanted in a career
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working here?

title: Ekg Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online in august didn't get a call until December, had interview in middle of December and started in January of the next year. Manager brought me in and asked some questions then I got to stay and job shadow.
Interview Questions: Are you able to work in stressful environment.

title: Account Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University Health in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Received a call to schedule initial phone screen. The phone screen was a joke. Recruiter could have simply been a robot. Very put off by this company's interview process. Again, a complete joke.
Interview Questions:
What are you currently doing?
Why you want this position?
Biggest weakness?
After spending an hour filling out their online assessment, then taking the time to set up a phone screen, you would think this company would put more emphasis on having a genuine concersation.

title: Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: Asked very easy and normal questions. One interview with supervisor and one with peers. All employees were very interested and friendly. It took longer than I had expected and remained in contact with the supervisor during the whole time. She was very helpful and encouraging.
Interview Questions: How to deal with difficult clients.

title: RCIS Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: It was a short turn around time, the manager was wiling to give a chance to inexperienced people. The questions were short and more to a customer service type help question. Not phone question and asked about the systems that you have ever worked on
Interview Questions: What are your technical skills

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy. Manager made me feel very relaxed. Questions are in the format of "Tell me about a time/situation when [this] happened and how did you fix/handle that situation
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you faced an obstacle, either in your personal life or at work, and how did you overcome that obstacle.

title: Communications Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was one over the phone interview and two in-person interviews. I met everyone that I'd be working with and they were very transparent about the job itself.  It was a pretty standard interview process, nothing really unexpected.
Interview Questions: We went through my resume together. I could tell they had definitely read it and asked very detailed questions about my past experience.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: On day ahead, Phone call form staffing agency to  set up the interview. Next, meeting 2 interviewees, no technical questions were asked. Just basic question tell us about yourself. and asking about some  SQL. overall  this interview was easy.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (LaPorte, IN) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: First there is a a one on one interview with the Medical Office Manager, once she chooses her favorite there is an interview with the doctor and colleagues. Once that interview is over you are to wait for a phone call and then proceed with your processing for the job
Interview Questions: What are your skill set?  How long have you been working in this field? If you could name a fault of yours what would you say it would be? How would you handle a stressful situation?

title: Applications Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Nice interview. Questions were straightforward and had to do with experience and education. Conversation flowed well with interviewer. I thought that the experience so far has been positive. I am still unsure of the outcome of the interview as they are still in the hiring process and hiring for a few different positions.
Interview Questions: What do you think your greatest weakness would be with the job description?

title: ICU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Bloomington, IN)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with Nusre Manager about position. I had worked at the hospital 4 yrs before entering nursing school. Quit and was rehired for position. Was well known. Started as nurse tech and worked my up to higher positions while learning new skills.  Total yrs worked at Blgtn Hosp was 17 years.
Interview Questions: Are you assertive? Afraid to ask Questions? Do you feel very knowledgable as a nurse just graduating. Are you going to get your feelings hurt when staff become very stern in stressful situations and start yelling out for needed help. Can you handle the high stress of becoming a Critical Care Nurse.

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Was called in with an initial interview with the reporting manager and team leader. Then I was told a little about the position. They did not talk specifics about the position so you will need to ask to get a fill of exactly you will be doing. 
I was called back for a second interview to meet the team I would be working with.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my Excel skills.

title: RN Associate Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN)
Interview Descriptions: I was called within a week of applying and flew out to Indianapolis where I met with a recruiter and set up three one to one interviews.  I received a job offer on the day of interview.
Interview Questions: General work history experience in a healthcare setting.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was smooth. First interview was with the manager. The second interview was with the nurses I would be working with. The process took longer than I would have liked since I had to interview with more than one person on different days.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a difficult situation and how did you handle it?

title: Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty standard. The interview lasted about one hour. There were two interviewers. I am actually going for a follow up interview soon. I look forward to meeting some of the great people that work for the company.
Interview Questions: They asked me what separated me from other candidates

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Did a phone interview with the hiring manager and then an onsite interview.  Met with the director who talked for about 25 minutes without asking any questions.  Then received a tour of the facility and had a question and answer session with the hiring manager.  A very quick and easy process.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about working in this culture?

title: Sterile Processing Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I received a phone call for an interview about 1 1/2 weeks after submitting my application and resume. For the interview, it was a group environment where I was asked questions by my "potential peers and supervisor" if i accepted a position with the company. The team members were very friendly, open to questions, and did an awesome job explaining the responsibilities of the position, what certifications I could take later on in the career, and available shifts. Any questions I had they were great in informing me on what exactly to expect if I accept the position and what they expect of me.

It took about two weeks from the date of the interview to receive a call back from HR to inform me that I received the job offer.
Interview Questions: Do you see yourself with the company in the next 5 years? Do you see this position as being a career for you in the future if offered the position? Tell us a little bit about yourself?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Muncie, IN) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with the manager and director. They ask a series of questions, they give you scenarios to see how you would handle them. It was a very smooth and painless process.
Interview Questions: Describe a time in which you had conflict in the workplace, how did you resolve it?

title: Cerner Applications Support Analyst - Intermediate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN)
Interview Descriptions: Initially contacted by Hiring Manager directly via email for on-site interview roughly a month after applying online. Met with management team and was invited back on-site for a peer review with 3 other team members and once again met with management team. After being notified I was referred back to HR for selection it took roughly 3 weeks to receive offer. Also had to attend a presentation by IU Health (geared more towards nursing, bedside manner, etc...) as well as obtain 5+ referrals with 40% needing to be previous supervisors in succession.
Interview Questions: Most questions very straight forward. Nothing above average difficulty or STAR formatted responses.

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: I met with the hiring manager and one peer. This has changed. You now meet with a panel of peers in the process. They will ask you a number of random questions. These will be different depending upon what they come up with. Peer interviews can go smoothly if there is an experienced manager/interviewer present. Otherwise, some can be awkward. Plan ahead what you want to say so you can lead the interview if the group is made up of peers who lack experience in this area.
Interview Questions: Tell me what you think you will be doing in this role.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview, health screen, I worked there before for several years and census got low, pay didn't increase for nurses, bonuses were non-existent... looks like they finally may realize how to keep the good people they have.
Interview Questions: I've worked there before, so no questions

title: Director Interview
