Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (La Porte, IN) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Started with an HR screening over the phone. I interviewed with interim director of the department.  I then moved on to a one-on-one interview with the COO.  A week later I had a followup panel interview with a group of executive directors and CFO.  Whole process took ~30 days from application to accepted offer.  All parties I interviewed with were friendly and the panel interview was actually quite fun.
Interview Questions: What have you done to engage colleagues.

title: PSA Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I went to the hiring office (I was already an existing employee) and shadowed half a day unpaid. I was then interviewed by the office coordinator and the office manager. It was very relaxed and easy going.
Interview Questions: Weaknesses, why I want to work there.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very simple. I met with the Onsite supervisor and she did most of the talking! I didn't have any type of competency testing and the hiring process was quick.
Interview Questions: What is the salary you are expecting?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview process took over 30 days, very inconvenient to wait that long. First had pre interview over the phone. I had to travel over an hour for interview so this was helpful to ask pertinent questions before going further with potential employer.  Interview took place at health center with director, assistant manager and lab director. Questions were appropriate but not enough time for me really get to know how operations of clinic were being handled.
Interview Questions: Describe your most difficult situation and how did you resolve it.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: I was called several days after I applied, was asked basic questions and offered an interview with managers.  The first available interview time was 2 weeks out.  Was never given the names of my interviewers or the specific place to go, and despite several unanswered emails, had to get that info from the HR secretary on the day of the interview.  The interview was thorough, but the interviewer was asking scripted complex questions from a packet, and transcribing my answers.  This took a very long time and made the flow awkward.  Finally, no salary could be quoted, the hours schedule was different from what was initially described, and the benefits were awful.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where your performance did not meet your supervisor's expectations.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: was very uncaring and cookie cutter interview my experience was very true to what i read on Glass door and from what people have told me. The HR person was not very friendly and certainly did not make me want to be an employee at her company. the interview was long and drawn out which made me wonder if this was the way the job would also be
Interview Questions: Did I have friends or family working there? I did and the person became much nicer to me which was a red flag to me but confirmed the reveiws

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: I was with the company as a contractor and after I demonstrated expertise they interviewed me for a full-time position. I interviewed with the hiring director and his direct report managers. The interview was brief, as all concerned had considered my performance and organizational fit before inviting me to interview.
Interview Questions: None of the questions were difficult or unexpected, as I was experienced and prepared.

title: Registered Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview from both direct manager and HR personnel.  I started working as a temp to hire via OfficeTeam/Robert Half Agency.  They needed staffing ASAP and I was scheduled for EMR within a few days so I could begin right away.  From my experience seeing some of the new employees' performance, I would imagine that references are not checked thoroughly.
Interview Questions: What was most difficult work situation? What did you learn from that experience?

title: Logistics Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: For this position I only had to do one interview which was nice, however, the initial training week was long, tedious, boring, and geared towards the nursing staff and not everyone.  The management team that I worked for was unorganized once I started, not having a plan in place for training, or even for when I first walked in the doors of the department.  I trained myself more than they gave me initial training.  My offer was sent to  me in an email instead of a phone call, I found this impersonal.  The recruiters there were either overwhelmed or did not enjoy their work as trying to get a call back or email back from them would take days at time, even as an employee looking to advance your career, you had to go through recruiters, and they were not interested in helping.
Interview Questions: Basic easy situational questions.  Nothing really meaty.  Everything is scripted based on your responses to the pre-employment survey that you take online.  It identifies strengths and weaknesses and your questions are based on those.  They tended to beat certain subjects to death.

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process began with email correspondence. Then, I was asked to submit my CV. After about three weeks, I was asked to come in for a face to face interview and given two dates to choose from. The dates were only three dates away! I worked both of them! But, after telling me they could not possibly make it another day, they called back and offered a workable time slot. The interview took place early on a Monday morning at a busy, downtown teaching hospital. The lady scheduling gave me poor directions and NO instructions on where to park. I had to valet park which cost money. Once there, the office was impossible to find without help. Once directed there, via a telephone call, the woman who called for directions was instructed to tell me to just walk in and have a seat. So, I did . Empty waiting room, typing in the background , no greeting, for 25 minutes!! Eventually , someone eventually came through the front door and grumbled " hello" after I said good morning ! Ten minutes later, that same grumbling women and the mystery typist appeared to conduct my interview . I was dressed and prepped for success. It was almost hard to take them serious!!!
Interview Questions: Tell us one time you lied or committed something illegal at the workplace. Then, what you did, or did not do to make it better.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Formal but comfortable.  My interviewer did not have any experience for the job they were interviewing me for though, and that became apparent very quickly after gaining employment.  It would have been helpful if the interviewer hadn't presented themselves as a proficient team member within my area of specialty.
Interview Questions: When was the last time you were late for work, and why?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied and a friend recommended me so I only had one interview with 3 managers and was offered the job when the interview was over.  Most people have interviews with management and peer interviews.
Interview Questions: Typical questions like "why do you want to work here" and "tell us about a time you had a disagreement with a coworker"

title: Rad Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was small and thorough. It was a relaxing setting and they were easy to talk to. It didn't take long after the interview for an offer. I did accept the job.
Interview Questions: What was a time when I had a disagreement or problem at work and how did I handle it.

title: RN - Associate Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very relaxed but professional. The people interviewing me had great questions about my prior work experience and education. I could tell that they were passionate about their jobs and looking for someone who was a good fit for the team.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a difficult situation and how you handled that situation.

title: Transformation Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Bloomington, IN) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very formal and had a panel of employees asking questions. First interview was with the director only and the second was with the team that I would be working with.
Interview Questions: What is one of your biggest strengths/weakness? Lots of scenario questions

title: RN CM Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Carmel, IN) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I meet with the Manager and all essential staff members to discuss job responsibilities, potential conflicts, concerns, benefits, flexibility, and the minimum number of hours expected to work.  We discussed the general work day and flow.  Expectations from the staff, leadership, patients and physicians were discussed.
Interview Questions: Explain your experience, when you worked at IU downtown?  How flexible are you?  What is your willingness to work more hours?   What hours do you desire to work?   Do you see any conflicts with home/family life?  How do you handle conflict?  Do you feel you are organized and can coordinate others well?  Do you like to work autonomously or as a team?  How would you describe your personality?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: There was a  phone interview, followed by a group interview. The group interview consisted of the team I was interviewing for. In general the team is/was extremely collaborative.
Interview Questions: The question that was most difficult was more of a situational question. For example how would you handle a difficult client, co-worker, etc and maintain a positive working relationship.

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of meeting with the manager and about two team members.  Everyone had a specific set of questions to ask and then take notes as to what my responses were.
Interview Questions: Where I would like to be within five years

title: RN Transfer Center Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Manager was aloof, unengaged during interview. Seemed to not have time for the interview, Enjoyed shadow experience, felt positive about this aspect. I was not told whether I had been accepted or rejected. Later saw the job posted, and la week later received rejection notice.
Interview Questions: What exactly makes you believe you will be a good fit in this area? Are you truly able to work with all kinds of people under time constraints and not get testy or irritable? Can you talk to Doctors clearly and efficiently?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got an email saying I was considered for the position. I received a phone call and was scheduled for a face to face interview. It was one on one with a manager/supervisor. I was introduced to the current staff during the process. They asked mostly behavioral questions and what I felt I could bring to the organization. The manager was extremely nice and inviting. I felt comfortable speaking with her. It was a pleasant experience and not an uptight interview, which I've had before.
Interview Questions: Q: Tell me about yourself

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I didn't have to interview at all..I worked there as a traveler and was offered a permanent position from  the manager of the department.  The only things I really had to do was pass the drug test.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Muncie, IN) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the 2 managers first, then a group peer interview immediately after. The two interviews took around 45 minutes total. After the initial interviews, they sent online survey links to my references and about a week later, I got a call from HR with a job offer.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you handled conflict with a client and what you did to rectify the situation.

title: Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was recommended by a college professor.
Interview Questions: As I was preparing to gradate from college and had not pinpointed where I wanted to be the most difficult question was, "Where do you see yourself in five years?"

title: Speech Pathologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Met with mostly all the different team members for ~1 hour in different groups. Shadowed for an afternoon. Asked clinical scenarios and skill set. Mostly conversational and not drilling.
Interview Questions: Clinical scenarios

title: Pharmacy Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Since this was for an internship the hiring process was really easy. I was taken for a lunch interview and asked some basic questions for background check up. My interests and other work ethics related questions.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions:
I was initially invited for an onsite interview where I was interviewed by two individuals for an hour.  

Just few days after it, I was invited for a second interview where I had three 1:1 interviews, one 5-panel interview, and also case study interview. 

All of the individuals I met looked excited and happy about their work.
Interview Questions: What aspect of your current job you dislike?

title: Analyst - IS Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very long process, even after the supervisor makes the decision to hire you.  I started two full months after my interview.
Interview Questions: None really.

title: Logistic Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Indiana University Health in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: A very long process that can take anywhere from one month to three months. I got in contact with the hiring manager through email, and had both an interview with my direct supervisor and other supervisors from connecting hospitals and then a one on one interview with the manager for the entire department. You must do an 8 hour orientation course the day prior to your first day. The job posting I applied for was for a different hospital and was listed at supplemental. The job ended up being full-time. The work environment is comfortable, the employees are tolerable and everyone seems comfortable with their job
Interview Questions: What is your weakness

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Lafayette, IN) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very professional interview experience. The culture seems good- focused on patient care and work-life balance. Had phone interview, then met with HR, then called back to meet with with decision-maker. The skills tests seemed fairly easy although vague and you can't solicit more info nor ask questions. Overall, the process was very good, and I would consider working here. Was offered position, declined for higher paying opportunity.
Interview Questions: N/a the inerview Qs were fairly predictable, and were relevant.

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very brief and impersonal. Basically we were bought out by them so it was just a formality if they were going to keep us or not. They met with us individually and asked how we would be an asset to the company if they were to offer us our current positions.
Interview Questions:
How long have you worked in the field.
How likely are you to stay if we present you a formal offer.
What are you duties/daily responsibilities with this company.

title: RN - Associate Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted by a nurse recruiter, who set up an interview. Had an interview with managers on unit first, then was asked back for a peer interview/shadowing day on the unit. Nurse recruiter was the person who called to extend job offer and give salary details after all interviews were complete.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Data Entry Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Talked with Human Resources then was led in to talk to who would be my boss.  Then got the job offer after. Fairly easy and neat to meet all the people that worked there before I started. Got the job offer after the interview that night. They asked if I could file, how fast I could type, and my past experience.
Interview Questions: How fast can you type?

title: Kitchen/Food Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Avon, IN) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: oh lord
Interview Questions: if you were a fruit what would you be and why?

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: The start of the interview process was to submit my application to the web site,  immediately receiving a "Thank you for your resume" email.  Next steps are to wait until the manager calls you for an interview, which can be quite lengthy.  After the interview, the interviewee will wait a couple of weeks for a response from the manager to determine the right candidate.  If the interviewee is the right candidate, HR will offer the position and salary is discussed with the HR staff.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Avon, IN) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed by the Manager of Med / Surgical units in 1 to 1.  The interview was an appropriate length of time, the interviewer was extremely professional and made you feel at ease.  Questions that I had were received well and was given knowledgeable answers.
Interview Questions: What type of challenge are you seeking?

title: PTA Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Met with all supervisors Ans team leaders then interviewed with PT department supervisor. Treated to lunch with staff members and toured all facilities . Wonderful, comfortable and stress free interview .
Interview Questions: Where I saw my career in 5 years ?

title: Marketing & Community Relations Intern Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Bloomington, IN) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: I found out about the position through the career counselor at school and sent the employer my cover letter, resume and writing samples. I then received an email asking me to come in for an interview. The two people I was interviewed by were super nice and friendly. It was casual but I still dressed up for the interview. They asked me questions like what are your future goals, why do you think you will succeed here, what are your strengths, and why are you interested in this program. After the interview I was told I would be contacted within a week if they were interested in me.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this program?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Avon, IN) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Placed application and submitted resume to HR Dept, received contact from recruiter, appointment set for interview with department manager.  Interview was in depth and a tour of the unit given and introduced to other employees.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to work at IU, what had I heard about working there?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: I sat for several interviews with this company, and the interview process varied greatly.  What kind of interview you get depends on the hiring manager that you have the 1:1 meeting with.  Some were informal interviews where the manager mainly described the unit and his or her managing philosophy, other managers used many behavioral interview questions along with questions that test your knowledge of basic nursing processes.
Interview Questions: You are notice a new pressure ulcer on a patient.  What do you document?

title: Technical Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Indiana University Health in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Submission via WEB Site.  Multiple face-to-face interviews.  Process was reasonable and professional.
Interview Questions: Was asked why someone with my background and experience wanted to take a cut in position and pay for the job offered.

title: Registration Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Indianapolis, IN) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: The process was very lengthy and it was very difficult to get my foot in the door. A friend of mine finally recommended me when she was leaving her position. I had one interview with the department manager and she told me during the interview that she planned to hire me, but that action would be delayed due to a hiring freeze. It was four months before she called me to offer me the position.
Interview Questions: Will you be able to work around terminally ill children?

title: Physician Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Goshen, IN) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: initial interviews are via the telephone in which I ask many questions just to get a feel for the candidate.  If I am satisfied with their answers, I call them back to schedule a second interview.  This interview would include another manager, my team leaders and possibly a physician.  After the inteview the group wil discuss what we thought.
Interview Questions: Why we shoud hire you.

title: Developer Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Indiana University Health in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Submit resume. Phone interview, ! on ! with manager, then group interview. Pee test, tax form and computer login. The overall process was very easy, you won't have a problem is you have the skill-set and can talk to people.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Muncie, IN) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions:
Called in for two interviews with the manager as well as the staff I would be working with.
Each interview lasted approximately 1 hour with everyone asking questions.
How did I rate myself as an employee, what would others say about me. How was my attendance and where do you see yourself in 5 years are just a few of the questions asked during the interviews.
Interview Questions: Most difficult question was explain a time when you felt you were not given proper credit for your job. This was a hard question because I don't do a job to get praise I do it because I care.

title: Unit Support Tech, Preop/Surgery Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Lafayette, IN) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was actually interviewed by someone brought in just for that purpose.   I was given a medical terms test and then interviewed by one of the two nurses who were going to supervise that department.
Interview Questions: How can you help in this department?

title: Care Tech/behvavior Care Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University Health in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by HR who set uo the interview with the manager of the psych unit.  The interview was ok as there were frequent interruptions by staff members. I was asked a bit about myself, my experience and where I planned to bring to the company. The decor in the hospital was drab and dark.
Interview Questions: Tell us what you bring to the orginization that will make me want to hire you?

title: Polysomnographer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University Health (Avon, IN) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by the manager and the supervisor.  Many detailed questions about job skills and the profession.  Was asked what I liked most and least about my profession.
Interview Questions: Always, why I want to leave my current position.  Some technical questions I wasn't expecting.

title: HIM Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University Health in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: for specialty positions like coding- coding test is required.  Behavioral questions are common practice, ex. how would you respond to this scenario, etc.
Interview Questions: Do you find it difficult to set priorities on work, multi-tasking?
